title: Dr Dee Amy-Chinn Gender Studies Scholarship
content: This scholarship for the MLitt / MSc Genders and Sexualities is funded by the family of our much-loved and much-missed colleague Dr Dee Amy-Chinn.

title: John Robert Hamilton Memorial Scholarship
content: The John Robert Hamilton Memorial Scholarship is available to give financial support to postgraduate students taking their history Masters degree at the University of Stirling.

title: Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC) Doctoral Studentships
content: This prestigious scholarship, funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council (AHRC), is for students doing a PhD in any field of the arts and humanities.

title: Funded PhD studentship looking at social and political reactions to HIV/AIDS
content: This PhD studentship will fund a project studying social and political reactions to HIV/AIDS. The postholder will collaborate with the team led by Dr Nikolaos Papadogiannis, working on the project “HIV/AIDS Campaigning between the Global South and Western Europe since the 1980s”, which is funded by a UKRI Future Leaders Fellowship.

title: Centre for the Sciences of Place and Memory PhD Studentships 2025
content: We are recruiting 2-4 PhD studentships, fully funded by the University of Stirling, which will aim to advance knowledge of the dynamic relations between place and memory.

title: International Sports Scholarship Programme
content: Our International Sports Scholarship Programme is one of the largest high performance sports programmes in the UK.

title: Sports scholarships (England, Wales, Northern Ireland, Republic of Ireland, EU or International)
content: These scholarships are part of the largest high-performance sports programme in the UK, which supports and sends athletes to Olympic, World and Commonwealth Games.

title: Nursing Scholarship and Access to Nursing Bursary (for students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland)
content: The Nursing Scholarship and Access to Nursing Bursary provides students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland with a £2,000 fee waiver each year on any one of our undergraduate Nursing courses.

title: Karen Napier Scholarship - MSc Investment Analysis
content: Two Karen Napier Scholarships are generously funded by the Karen Napier Fund and the University of Stirling Management School in memory of Karen, a graduate of the MSc in Investment Analysis.

title: ICAS Foundation Scholarship
content: The ICAS Foundation Programme provides an all-encompassing range of support for students planning to study accounting or finance at university.

title: Extra Time Award
content: This scholarship is funded by the Scottish Football Association and the Scottish Government to research the Scottish FA’s Extra Time programme for a three-year PhD project.

title: Gordon Social Innovation Scholarship - Ecosystems Project
content: Supports the development of social innovation research capacity at the University of Stirling by funding one PhD studentship.

title: Gordon Social Innovation Scholarship – Power Project
content: This scholarship will support the development of social innovation research capacity at the University of Stirling.

title: The Mister Gees Foundation Scholarship
content: Financial assistance for a full-time UK student studying MSc Sustainable Aquaculture at the Institute of Aquaculture.

title: Ronald Miller Scholarship
content: The scholarship will be awarded to a student who has achieved an unconditional place at the University of Stirling to study MSc Sustainable Aquaculture.

title: British Council Women in STEM Scholarship
content: Scholarship for exceptional female STEM students offering a monthly stipend, travel costs, visa and insurance costs and more.

title: Nikos Steiropoulos Scholarship
content: The scholarship will be awarded to a student who will join MSc Aquatic Pathobiology, MSc Aquatic Veterinary Studies or MSc Sustainable Aquaculture in September 2024.

title: The Anne Wingate Paterson Scholarship
content: Awards will be made to individuals with a place on a postgraduate programme for the study and prevention of child abuse and neglect.

title: British Council Scholarship for English Language Teachers India
content: This scholarship is available to Indian students who are studying MSc TESOL (Online) on a part-time, distance-learning basis over 30 months.

title: NHS Social Work Bursary
content: The Social Work Bursary is available for undergraduate and postgraduate students on our Social Work courses to support creating skilled and qualified social workers.

title: Waste/Land/Futures: intergenerational relations in places of abandonment and renewal across Europe
content: An exciting PhD opportunity to work on the Volkswagen Foundation-funded project ‘Waste/Land/Futures: Intergenerational Relations in Places of Abandonment and Renewal across Europe.’ Together with researchers from the UK, Germany, Austria and Romania, the project will study communities in places of abandonment, loss and renewal in western and eastern Europe.

title: Honours Year Scholarship
content: Students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland, Republic of Ireland, the Channel Islands and the Isle of Man can get a scholarship covering fees for their Honours year of study.

title: Undergraduate Merit Scholarship
content: This scholarship provides a £1,000 cash award per year (for Years 1–3) for eligible students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland.

title: EU Undergraduate Scholarship
content: The EU Undergraduate Scholarship provides fee discounts and costs for EU students studying at the University of Stirling.

title: International Undergraduate Scholarship
content: Our International Undergraduate Scholarship offers eligible students £2,000 per year (£8,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: GEMS International Undergraduate Scholarship
content: Our GEMS International Undergraduate Scholarship offers eligible students £2,000 each year (£8,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Transnational Education (TNE) Partner Transfer Scholarship
content: A 20% tuition fee waiver for Transnational Education (TNE) students who transfer from an official TNE partner of the University to study at Stirling for a year or more at an undergraduate level.

title: Robertson Trust Scholarship
content: Financial support for 16 to 25 year olds in Scotland who face barriers to higher education.

title: Undergraduate USA Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate USA Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Canada Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate Canada Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate South Africa Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate South Africa Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Zimbabwe Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate Zimbabwe Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate United Arab Emirates (UAE) Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate United Arab Emirates Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Malaysia Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate Malaysia Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Hong Kong Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate Hong Kong Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Undergraduate Norway Scholarship
content: Our Undergraduate Norway Scholarship offers eligible students £5,000 per year (£20,000 over four years) towards the payment of annual fees.

title: Stirling Welcome Scholarship
content: The Stirling Welcome Scholarship provides a £1,000 cash award to all undergraduate students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland who enrol as a student on a course delivered at the University's Stirling campus.

title: Stirling Success Scholarship
content: £5,000 Stirling Success Scholarship package for all eligible students from England, Wales, Northern Ireland and Republic of Ireland commencing studies from September 2026.

title: Postgraduate Merit Scholarship
content: We are offering all UK or Republic of Ireland students with a first-class Honours degree (or equivalent) a £2,000 scholarship to study full-time on any taught Masters course. The award is offered on a pro-rata basis for students who are studying part time.

title: EU Postgraduate Scholarship
content: The EU Postgraduate Scholarship provides a fee discount for EU students studying at the University of Stirling.

title: The Data Lab Scholarships
content: We are offering fully funded places on a selection of on-campus Masters courses in partnership with The Data Lab and the Scottish Funding Council.

title: Commonwealth Shared Scholarships
content: Commonwealth Shared Scholarships are for candidates from developing Commonwealth countries, looking to study selected postgraduate Masters courses.

title: Stirling Alumni Scholarship
content: This scholarship provides a discount for the first year of a full-time or part-time Masters degree for students who have completed their undergraduate degree at the University of Stirling.

title: Saint Andrew's Society of the State of New York Scholarship
content: For the academic year 2025-2026, the St Andrew's Society for the State of New York is offering two scholarships to Scottish students wishing to study for a postgraduate master's in the United States. Each studentship will have a maximum value of $45,000 USD.

title: Postgraduate East Asia Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students who are living in mainland China, Hong Kong (SAR), Japan, Macau, South Korea, or Taiwan.

title: Postgraduate Ghana Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students living in Ghana.

title: Postgraduate India Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students living in India.

title: Postgraduate Kenya Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students living in Kenya.

title: Postgraduate Nigeria Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students living in Nigeria.

title: Postgraduate Pakistan Scholarship
content: This scholarship is open to full-time, on-campus, self-funding students living in Pakistan.

title: Singapore Institute of Management Postgraduate Scholarship
content: This scholarship is for the first year of a full-time Masters degree, and is available to international students who have graduated from our partner, Singapore Institute of Management, with a University of Stirling undergraduate degree.

title: Lingnan University Postgraduate Scholarship
content: This scholarship is awarded for the first year of a full-time Masters degree and is available to international students who have graduated from our Hong Kong partner, Lingnan University, with a University of Stirling undergraduate degree.

title: Chevening Scholarships
content: Chevening Scholarships is the UK government's scholarships programme for international students studying Masters degrees.

title: The Fulbright University of Stirling Award
content: The University of Stirling and the Fulbright Commission offers funding for postgraduate studies in health, wellbeing or sports science.

title: Postgraduate Taught International Partnerships Scholarship
content: A tuition fee waiver on any full-time on-campus postgraduate taught course at the University of Stirling for eligible international students.

title: Aziz Foundation Scholarship
content: The Aziz Scholarships Programme offers 100% tuition fee scholarships to support British Muslims to study for a Masters at partnered UK universities.

title: Be the Difference Postgraduate International Scholarship
content: £7000 tuition fee waiver for the first year of a Masters degree and is open to full-time self-funding students who are classed as international for tuition fee purposes starting in September 2025 or January 2026.

title: Commonwealth Masters Scholarships
content: The agency-nominated Master’s programme is one of three Master’s programmes offered by the Commonwealth Scholarship Commission.

title: Commonwealth PhD Scholarships
content: Commonwealth PhD Scholarships are for applicants from least developed countries and fragile states looking for full-time doctoral study at a UK university.

title: INTO Stirling Progression Scholarships
content: As part of our commitment to attracting the very best students to join our diverse international community, we are delighted to offer the INTO Stirling Progression Scholarships.

title: Institute for Advanced Studies Studentships
content: We're investing in the next generation of world-class researchers.

title: The Reid Family Scholarship (Widening Participation)
content: We support Scottish students from Widening Participation backgrounds to help with the financial pressures of living costs and tuition fees so you can achieve your full potential.

title: ESRC-funded studentship opportunities: Scottish Graduate School of Social Science
content: The Scottish Graduate School of Social Science's Scottish Doctoral Training Partnership provides studentship awards each year to students to allow them to do a funded PhD in the social sciences.

title: Stirlingshire Educational Trust
content: Grants available to persons who have been resident in Stirlingshire, either currently or in the past, for a period of at least 5 consecutive years or have been born there.

title: Sanctuary scholarships
content: Sanctuary scholarships are awarded to postgraduate, access and undergraduate students who are in the UK and have applied for asylum or are staying in the UK as refugees or on humanitarian grounds.
